descp2: int, cross-validation generator or an iterable, optional Determines the cross-validation splitting strategy. Possible inputs for cv are: - None, to use the default 5-fold cross validation, - integer, to specify the number of folds in a `(Stratified)KFold`, - :term:`CV splitter`, - An iterable yielding (train, test) splits as arrays of indices. For integer/None inputs, if the estimator is a classifier and ``y`` is either binary or multiclass, :class:`StratifiedKFold` is used. In all other cases, :class:`KFold` is used. Refer :ref:`User Guide <cross_validation>` for the various cross-validation strategies that can be used here.
